intro: Leucadenia pilosa, commonly known as the hairy leucadenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in coastal and sandy habitats. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its showy, tubular flowers are typically pink or purple and attract pollinators such as birds and insects. Leucadenia pilosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
